is gud

Infinitely disappointing. This game is perfect example of how the industry undeservedly over-hypes its games and how game reviewers are nothing but paid industry shills over-inflating rating scores by an absurd margin.  This game is mediocre at best, maybe garnering a 5 on a scale of 1 to 10.  While the story setting and concepts are somewhat novel to the gaming industry, the gameplay is trite, the game's setting/environment is largely uninteractable with the character, and the lack of any player freedom or agency is unforgiveable.  Why this game is even a first-person shooter (and a lack-luster, yet superfluously ultra-violent one at that) escapes me.  Playing this game forced me to re-evaluate Bioshock 1 and 2 as being a much more worthy and enjoyable gaming experience: requiring much more thoughtful combat strategy, possessing a completely immersive and evocative setting (with denizens that actually react to your presence), and wonderful over-arching story themes that aren't abandoned half-way through the game or (worse) mis-represented to teach precisely the wrong moral.  At this game's end, the only theme you will glean from this story is one of utter futility in having played it.
Best game in the Bioshock series yet. After being trapped in Rapture for the past two games, Columbia is a breath of fresh air. The graphics are fantastic and the twist ending is devastating!

Everything great about this game has already been said so I'll point out a couple things I didn't find "great."

1. I've always leaned in favor of nonlinear games or games that offer more than one solution to problem(s) presented in-game. Bioshock always felt (to me) as if I were directed toward a certain experience - the "only" experience the developer intented. I respect the idea of "vision" but prefer not to be "forced" to play a certain style.

2. There should have been a weight limit rather than item limit. If I have a favored firearm I've upgraded completely I should not be forced to equip another weapon for lack of ammo in the former. 

Overall: 8/10
Truly the greatest game I have ever played.

This game seemed to discover a way to look good on the first playthrough, but every time I think of it afterward, it finds a new way to come up short. The gameplay is fine for the most part, though there is the section where it forces you to fight the same boss three times with infinitely spawning goons swarming you and very little ammo. I've no idea what was going through the development team's heads when they okayed that sequence. It's absolutely abysmal and drops the player into a braindead state, the last thing a Bioshock game of all things would want to do.

The story comes off as smart the first time around, but it's easy to poke at until it pops and farts away like a balloon. I just couldn't help but think of how the first game performed all its world building so admirably through the setting, characters, and gameplay while Infinite attempts to capture the same magic but does it only half as well. None of the ideals of Columbia are redeemable in the slightest especially in comparison to those of Rapture, so it makes it really difficult to view any of the characters as anything other than gigantic pricks. Where Andrew Ryan was a hounding the player and being an unlikeable fellow in the original game, at least he had some reasonable ideals that one could actually consider as not being horrible if they weren't taken to such extremes. Comstock on the other hand built a city based on nationalism and white supremacy. How on earth am I supposed to take a guy like that seriously?

The only likeable character of the bunch is Elizabeth, but it feels like they could have done so much more by her. The developers attempted to make her appear useful by having her throw ammo and medkits at the player, but this just breaks up the gameplay with implausible moments of player invulnerability and isn't something I was incapable of doing myself by just taking a look around. It also happened at moments of extreme convenience for the player, and dropped the difficulty down on a game that already wasn't that hard. She's also completely invulnerable to everything on the field and invisible to boot. Last time I played a game that put this much emphasis on an escort mission, it was called Resident Evil 4 and turned out to be a masterpiece. Your A.I. companion in that game could get hurt, but she did an incredible job of ducking under the player's fire if they aimed anywhere near her, and she was integrated into some of the puzzles and obstacles in simple and clever ways. It never felt like a chore taking her around because the game gave just the right amount of leeway to make mistakes, but was still punishing should the player take their time in preventing her capture or neglect her health. Back to Elizabeth, it feels like a slap in the face to a character like that if you're going to take so much time integrating her into the plot and making her the only likeable character if you can just remove her from the gameplay experience and feel hardly any difference at all. 

Bioshock Infinite is seemingly good the first time, and if you really must play this game, you should probably keep it that way and lock your thoughts on it and throw away the key. Unfortunately we're not robots, and that's not a thing we can actually do. I can see all sorts of people revisiting this game like I have and noticing the luster of the experience gone and the wonder of this world evaporating. Eh, at least I got to shoot ravens out of my hands or something.

A materpiece,  History in the making, A cylce at it's begining, apex and end.

This...game...  is not what it apears to be on the surface, don't be fooled, it may have the skin of a first person shooter but at it's heart it is something so, much, more.

Armed with some of the best graphics of the decade, a story that will suck you right in at it's begining and leave you breathless at it's end, Choices that will let you carve said story in slight way that have a suppriseingly huge impact in the final chapters, and lastly, a heart and soul...

Enter at your own risk my freinds, for behind this buy botton lays infinate hours of awe, enjoyment, puzzle solving, action, inspireing diolouge, and an entire world in the clouds that will rip the breath right out of your lungs.

This game was a trip, like a lot of recent games it had some sections that were very abstract and this is a theme I really enjoy. I immensely enjoyed the guns, just as much as the last two if not more both in their quality of design and in application in the game. I liked the last battle of the game and it was pretty epic but, spoilers, you weren't the one doing the majority of the fighting and I was hoping you would get to fight songbird on your own at somepoint. Besides those small gripes, this game is far more cinematically engaging and visually captivating than the last two, and the way that colubmia differs from rapture will make it feel like its own world while maintaining the distinct style and masterful use of music and sound to engage the player that you got from the first two bioshock games.
Buy this game now.

Игра мне очень понравилась, так как помимо основной сюжетной линии в BioShock Infinite присутствуют и дополнительные задания. Конечно, их немного, но это хорошая возможность отвлечься от сюжетной миссии и обойти каждый коридор в поисках разных ценностей, начиная от сейфов и заканчивая экстрактами и отмычками.
  Кажется, что сюжет достаточно прост и понятен. Но по мере прохождения все становится намного запутанней и в некоторых моментах просто голова кружится от параллельных измерений и временных разрывов. И уже ближе к финальной сцене начинаешь понимать, что к чему.
  10/10 крюков

Игра просто отличная. Я довно хотел в нее поиграть, но я даже не знал на сколько тут афигенный сюжет. В принципе геймплэй тут довольно скучноватый я играл на среднем уровни сложности и эти сверхспособности мне нафиг ненужны были. Ибо я всех мочил с обычного пистолета. Так вот на счет сюжета он тут очень запутанный и непонятный, но после того как вы пройдете игру всё станет на свои места и вы всё поймёте, а если нет то тогда пройдите ее еще раз(как лалка лол).
Игра стоит своих денег. 9/10. Советую всем.

Ураганный шутер. Весьма необычный геймплей. До мелочей продуманный сюжет. Приятная графика. Потрясающий саундтрек. Превосходный дизайн локаций. Это и многое другое...
Но главные слова характеризующие игру: утопия, тлен, бесконечность.
Тут больше нечего говорить - запускай и играй!
10/10.

Вот и закончил проходить столь красочную и великолепную игру.Остался очень доволен, что приобрел сей шедевр,хоть и не сразу прошел,так как процесс игры шел перед экзаменами и мне пришлось отодвинуть BioShock Infinite, и готовится к ним.И через 3 месяца я решил до конца пройти её.
Сразу могу сказать,что очень понравилась графика,сюжет сам собой хорош,единственное что приедалось,так это хождение "туда - сюда",но пожалуй это присутствует не только в этой игре.Концовка очень удивила,ни капли банальщины,а наоборот трудно понять весь смысл сказанного и увиденного.В итоге оценка сей игры 10/10,пожалуй любители сего жанра останутся довольны.
P.s Захотелось пройти первую-вторую часть BioShock :D

Following on the great success of the 1st two games of this genre (bioshock 1 & 2) comes Infinite! 

As the core game goes I ventured upon the following differences cautiously!

1. The platform or playing area/space is a LESS crowded scenario than before! In Bioshock 1 & 2, I constantly felt subdued by the environment; here there is air-to-breathe!

2. I felt like there were more pick-ups in Bioshock 1 & 2. (somewhere the sense that the DLC I bought made the difference in pick-ups was a scary thought...what would I have done without them?).

3. Ok, the central game, most is played in the BLUE-SKIES. Compared with the DEEP-BLUE-SEAS like in Bioshock 1 & 2 (no problem with that-the dlc has more DEPTH DIVING so to speak).

4.Alright. The mad-magazine humor-me horror does continue but not to the extent it did in Bioshock 1 & 2. Bioshock 1 & 2 MADE FULL USE OF THE SCREAM QUALITY in that way of thinking! Where-in the previous installments this was an unreasonable rambling that could be ignored; with enough attention NOW there is an attempt here to LOGICATE the craziness here (MAKE IT SENSIBLE-more so than before)! The villains intellect here is higher than the ZOMBIE level it was before.

5.Then the issue of saving little girls from the error of their ways (NOTE : a very moral issue) IS NOT EVEN HERE! Sure you're WITH Elizabeth and she's your partner, but it's NOT THE MAJOR ISSUE IT WAS TO BE SAVING HER! She is your partner (think co-op)! The mislead little girls aren't sprawling like they were! 

6.The idea of tears is an interesting one where I have seen it repeated in the game CONTRAST (CONTRAST feels like a genuine spin-off of THIS GAME, saying that in a good light, reminiscent).


The following you may want to note!

A)-As a package I am pleased in purchasing Infinite! The DLC offers another 2 full on single player campaigns! Ace!

B)-The cassettes with comment are interspersed throughout the game in the tradition of Bioshock.

C)-If you're wanting a "Bioshock" game then this IS YOUR THING, get it! It does stray a little from the formula of the 1st two games but it's Bioshock all the way!

Game on.

Это ШЕДЕВР!!! За последнее время я очень редко играл в такие игры, где от концовки мне становилось плохо (последней, кстати, была Saya no Uta). Шикарнейщий, лихо закрученный экшн с чуть более чем ничего РПГ, и такая концовка...
По поводу самого геймплея, то он немного подкачал. НО! Аэрокрюк и все с ним связанное - это огромный плюс. А если еще взять  тот факт, что это происходит во времена стимпанка (а он мне очень нравится), то все эти минусы ты начинаешь замечать только тогда, когда ты сам хочешь их найти.

Эту игру должен поиграть каждый, кому важен сюжет. Хотя и экшена, и всего остального здесь хватает.

จะมีอะไรดีไปกว่าการได้นั่งเสพเกมจาก Irrational Games ฝีมือของ Ken Levine ที่ให้อะไรมากกว่าคำว่าเกมแต่ได้ยัด story เทียบชั้นหนังของ Martin Scorsese และ Christopher Nolan บวกกับงานศีล Steampunk ที่ทำออกมาได้เหนือจินตนาการเห็นแล้วน้ำหูน้ำตาไหล

ส่วนเกมเพลย์บอกได้เลยว่าได้รับการพัฒนาจากภาคก่อนหน้านี้ให้มีความไหลลื่นขึ้น การใช้พลังแบบใหม่ที่ดูน่าสนใจ แม้บางอย่างจะเป็นการหยิบของเก่ามาปะแป้งใหม่ก็ตามทีผมก็ยังรู้สึกสนุกในการพลิกแพลงการจัดการศัตรูระหว่างเล่น นี่ยังไม่รวมลูกเล่นใหม่ของภาคลอยฟ้าอย่าง skyhook ที่จะทำให้เราสนุกไปกับการกระโดดไปบนเมืองลอยฟ้าเพื่อกระทืบศัตรู ,สิ่งหนึ่งที่อาจจะดูขัดใจสำหรับคนที่ติด Bioshock ภาคแรกมาก่อนก็ตรงที่ภาคใหม่นี้เราจะไม่ค่อยได้เจออารมณ์ในลักษณะศัตรูตัวโหดระหว่างทางเหมือนกับการเจอ Big Daddy ในภาคแรกเท่าไรนัก เอาเป็นว่าโดยรวมเรื่องเกมเพลย์คงใช้คำไหนอธิบายไม่ได้นอกจากคำว่ามัน 'สนุก' และการที่ได้มานั่งขบคิดเรื่องราว อะไร ทำไม อย่างไร หลังจากการเล่นจบจะเป็นอะไรที่สนุกยิ่งกว่า

Pros:
-Looks great
-Fascinating story

Cons:
-Gameplay is repetitive and dull

As a gamer who plays games for the gameplay I was disappointed. Typically the player character will be walking through a beautiful atmosphere when a wave of trash enemies that take too long to kill and hardly do anything charge out. With weak guns and healthy enemies the majority of combat time is spent reloading behind cover, or reloading while running away. There are certain interesting mechanics included that allow the player to create cover, health packs, sentries, etc. but they are often too weak or useless to be bothered with. The first enemies met are the majority of enemies fought throughout the game so after 20 minutes the game's combat can be almost fully explored.

This couldve been a great movie, but is not engaging enough to be worthwhile as a game.

Overview: A fantastic story-driven FPS that has aged surprisingly well. A combination of excellent gameplay and mindbending plot make it well worth the playthrough. Purchasing a DLC bundle is highly recommended. 

****

Bioshock Infinite is a single-player story-driven FPS developed by Irrational Games, the same studio that developed the original Bioshock. Bioshock Infinite is a spiritual successor to the aforementioned game, it's set in its own universe but has strong ties with the first two games. 

I’ve played this game approximately three times over the years, coming back to it once in a while when I feel the need for an exciting FPS game that I could finish relatively quickly. In some ways, Bioshock Infinite is exactly that. The game is about 12 hours long, plus a few more hours if you try to complete the small side quests.

However, Bioshock Infinite is so much more than a fun FPS. Its one of the best FPS’s ever made. Much of its appeal stems from its insane plot. Bioshock Infinite starts off relatively simple; “bring us the girl and wipe away the debt”. To that end, you are blasted off to the utopian flying city of Columbia. From there, the plot goes of the rails in the best possible way. The story is constantly surprising you, going in wild directions that you never expected. You soon find out that underneath that thin utopian veneer that Columbia holds up, lies a dark, ugly society built on oppression and racism. And the simple task that you were given is revealed to be far more complicated than initially thought.  

As is tradition for Bioshock games, the story touches on deeper (and surprisingly timely) themes of racism, redemption, American exceptionalism, theocracy and religious oppression, capitalism, and class warfare. How well the writing handles such themes is up for debate, but I loved that the plot was able to address these ideas in its story. It all culminates in a heartbreaking finale that seemingly comes out of nowhere, but playing through it again, you see the subtle foreshadowing the whole time. 

The characters are a large part of Bioshock’s success. Elizabeth, especially, stands out. Her Disney princess inspired character design is attractive and she’s brought to life through animations, voice acting, and writing. Its both endearing and sad to see this naïve girl we meet slowly change into a hardened woman, not through her change in costumes, but her portrayal. Elizabeth is one of the best characters in video games. 

Booker DeWitt, played brilliantly by Troy Baker, initially starts off as yet another badass player character to self-insert in. He is soon revealed to be a far more complicated person and takes on a larger role in the story that what it is initially implied.

Bioshock Infinite’s story is paced far differently from the Bioshock 1 and 2. Those games saw you as a nameless protagonist wandering through the dead and decaying ruins of a once thriving decadent city, slowly uncovering its secrets and how it fell. Bioshock Infinite sees you arrive to the decadent city at the height of its opulence, only to be the herald of its destruction. It’s a different kind of story that might throw off people who preferred the more melancholic tone and slower pacing of the former games.

Accordingly, gameplay in Bioshock Infinite is far more action focused. Combat in Bioshock Infinite is brutal, action-packed, and incredibly satisfying. There are numerous weapons in the game, encompassing the standard pistol, machine gun, sniper rifle, and shotgun, but also includes other weapons such as my beloved hand cannon and the volley gun. All the weapons look great and feel satisfying to shoot. 

Most fights also have skylines which you can jump onto and ride them like a roller coaster, letting you shot at enemies as you go up and reposition. Jumping on and off a skyline never gets old. 

Vigors function much like the plasmids in Bioshock. You can unlock up to eight vigors and use them to augment the gunplay; such as throwing balls of fire, unleashing crows, or charging forward with an explosive blast. I have to admit I prefer the vigors over the plasmids; they are much more impactful in terms of gameplay, beyond the strictly supportive role that plasmids had. They also function very differently from one other, giving you freedom in how you engage enemies. I loved using the Charge vigor to zip around and then blast someone in the face with a shotgun. 

The game boasts some RPG elements. You can purchase weapon upgrades as you go through the game, allowing you to strengthen certain weapons or vigors that you like to use. You can also find clothing items, which you can equip to give you passive buffs that incredibly impactful. All this gives you a certain amount of freedom you don't find often from these kinds of games.

With all these strengths, it’s disappointing that we are limited to only carrying two weapons at a time. Its one of my biggest criticisms of the gameplay. I feel that it would have been far stronger and more engaging had we been able to cycle between four weapons instead of two. The iron sights are also toggle only, as opposed to the standard “hold to go to iron sights”. Iron sights are arguably less important in a Bioshock game (I stopped using them entirely) but I would have preferred that option be there, especially for people who like using the carbine or sniper rifle. 

Visually, Bioshock Infinite has aged well. The city of Columbia is still dazzling when you first arrive and the characters still look pretty great. Not only is the music great and fitting for the setting, but its also used to great effect to highlight the overarching parallel universes theme. There's also this haunting sting whenever you melee execute an enemy that is both chilling and awesome. 

In summation, Bioshock Infinite is a game that is absolutely worth your time. Its a game with fantastic gameplay and deep, creative story, and touches on themes that'll have you pondering about it for a long time. Its a relatively short game, so its perfect for those with busy schedules who don't want to commit to a 40+ hour playthrough.

AAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAHHHHHHHAHAHAHAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAA
Amazing.

ICH BIN ENTTÄUSCHT.

Ganz ehrlich, ich bin ein riesiger Bioshock-Fan. Bioshock 1 war genial. Die Atmosphäre war bombastisch. Der Horror war ebenfalls vertreten, alles war beklemmend, die Grafik für die Zeit einzigartig. 18 Stunden Spielzeit hatte ich für die Story. DLC gab es ja nicht.

Bioshock 2 war immer noch Spitze, wenn auch mit rund 14 Stunden etwas kürzer. Die Atmosphäre war nicht mehr ganz so dicht, die Story dafür auf einem hohen Niveau.  Den DLC habe ich gekauft, aber noch nicht gespielt.

Bioshock Infinite ist der neueste, teuerste und mit zwölf Stunden kürzeste Teil der Serie. Die beklemmende Atmosphäre ist nicht mehr vorhanden.
Ich kann leider nicht verstehen, wie andere Spieler hier 50 Stunden lassen, habe aber die DLC noch nicht gespielt.

Für einen Singleplayer-Shooter immer noch eines der besten Spiele des Genres. Für ein Bioshock... Fans werden es spielen, aber nach der kurzen Story schockiert sein - innerhalb der letzten dreißig Minuten bekommt der Protagonist erklärt warum seine elfeinhalb Stunden Spielzeit umsonst waren, sein Gegner eigentlich noch lebt und er ihn nicht töten kann. Super, das hätte man sich echt sparen können.

Bioshock Infinite is a must-have for those who enjoy the 1920s aesthetic and great characters. The game does not really pick up until you meet Elizabeth (Booker being sort of a surrogate main character up till that point). The story and atmosphere are extremely compelling and the game does not ignore some of the sensitive political and social issues that existed during that era, though it only makes short notice of it and could have served an interesting subplot. It's nothing like its horror-ridden undersea predecessors and markets to a different audience but enjoyable all the same, perhaps even more meaningful, depending on what sort of experience you pull away from it.

Only downside is possibly combat. While it's doable, it's not always enjoyable & quite a few gunfights feel as if they've been copy-pasted from other sections of the game making them feel repetitive and pointless.

But it's okay because of the story and because of Elizabeth. Everything else pales in comparison to what this game has to offer in terms of depth of narrative and Elizabeth's characterization. Very few games truly capture the heart and I think that this can be considered among them.
Love it.  Gameplay is a little basic (wish I could hold more guns) otherwise really smooth and looks amazing!  If you are a fan of the other bioshocks this game is for you!
